intro: Pycnocoma macrophylla var. microsperma, commonly known as the narrow-seeded pycnocoma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a glossy surface, while the flowers are often pink or purple in color. This variety is distinguished by its smaller seeds compared to other varieties within the species.
